kimononet.stat

Class StatPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • kimononet.stat.StatPacket

  • public class StatPacket
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a shallow copy of a packet. This is useful in situations where we are only interested in information relevant to gathering statistical information. For creating statistical packets from either beacon packets or data packets use StatPacket(BeaconPacket) or StatPacket(DataPacket, PeerAddress) accordingly.
    Since:
    3/12/2012
    Version:
    3/14/2012
    Author:
    Zorayr Khalapyan

    • Constructor Detail

      • StatPacket

        public StatPacket(PacketType type,
          PeerAddress source,
          PeerAddress destination,
          PeerAddress node,
          ForwardMode mode)
        Creates a new packet with the specified values.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the packet.
        source - The original source of the packet. This value should be constant across the life cycle of the packet.
        destination - The destination address of the packet.
        node - The node handling the packet.
        mode - Mode of forwarding. If the packet is not a data packet,this value should be null.

      • StatPacket

        public StatPacket(BeaconPacket beaconPacket)
        Creates a new statistical packet based on the provided beacon packet. Since the beacon packet does not have a specified destination address, this field will be set to null. Furthermore, source and node will be both set to the address of the peer represented by the beacon packet.
        Parameters:
        beaconPacket - The packet to use to create the shallow copy statistical packet.

      • StatPacket

        public StatPacket(DataPacket dataPacket,
          PeerAddress node)
        Creates a new statistical packet based on the provided statistical packet.
        Parameters:
        dataPacket - The packet to use to create the shallow statistical packet. Information used will include type, peer address, and destination peer address.
        node - The node handling the packet. This might be either the source, the destination, or an intermediary node.

    • Method Detail

      • isSource

        public boolean isSource()
        Returns true if the source of the current node is equal to the node handling the current packet; otherwise, the method will return false.
        Returns:
        True if node is the same as source.

      • isSink

        public boolean isSink()
        Returns true if the destination of the current node is equal to the node handling the current packet; otherwise, the method will return false.
        Returns:
        True if node is the same as #destination.

        Returns the type of the packet.
